node.text:
“‘Boys will boys’ is no longer an excuse. We need to hold each other accountable and be better leaders for our sons and young men of this generation.” .
Thank you @gillette for your message 💙 #thebestmencanbe
.
#children4change
#equality 
#respect
#endviolence 
#sexualharassment
#ikutcarakita
Protect our girls and boys 🙌
"toxic masculinity". Pls dont let Malaysia end up like America. #BoycotteGillete
Malaysia hv alot of toxic masculinity tbh

Honestly this is the most ridiculous ad made by Gillette... What happened to "the best a man can get" ? You've totally slaughtered that slogan. No wonder Gillette received so many back lash from this one ad.
Man, this is very TRUE, cartoon, movie, and the others always add a sensitive and sexual content
I'm confused
@cobbalt.madinchi what’s wrong with this ad? Do you have a problem with Gilette telling some men that do this that they should be better? 😂
@xblarief the toxic masculinity jumped out with this one 👏🏽😂
Wonderful job @unicefmalaysia MEN SHOULD HOLD OTHER MEN ACCOUNTABLE. Be better, be real men.
@itsjustrenelle sameeeeeeee i felt so freakin weird when "men" started being so sensitive abt tis when they never were b4
@danielkueh_ exactly! It’s literally only directed to men that do all these thingS, meaning that people that get angry with this ad don’t like that they have been told to “be better” PATHETIC
@itsjustrenelle YASSS FINALLY SOMEONE THT UNDERSTAND
@danielkueh_ thank YOU for being a real man ✨
@itsjustrenelle im actually quite effeminate and ended up being bullied by the "real men"
@danielkueh_  doesn’t matter to me, I’ll respect you regardless. Thank you for being a decent human being. 💕
@itsjustrenelle 😚😚😚😚🤣
@cobbalt.madinchi wdym ridiculous? Boys never call out other boys when they bully a boy for being "girly" even tho all the boy did was hanging out with girls,wear "feminine" coloured clothes.
@lychee_lysa girls never call out girls when they're being too "manly" what point are you proving?

@itsjustrenelle exactly... They should never tell anyone to be better men... Some men are some men aren't... We are all unique in our own way.... BTW this ad is like blaming men for most of the things... They never mention men getting harrassed by women and men getting raped by women

@cobbalt.madinchi um sorry, if you think that harassing, touching and letting your sons beat up weaker kids is part of being a man, you were raised very wrongly and I’m sorry you had to go through that. This ad is just for men who do these awful things under the pretence of “masculinity”. Gillette is asking these men to BE BETTER. The AMOUNT of ads that tell women to be fairer, be thinner, be more ladylike can’t even compare to this, do you hear us complaining? ONE TIME a company tells men how to behave like adults and yall go batshit crazy. Please. Save it.
@itsjustrenelle what made you think I was raised that way?
@itsjustrenelle and what made you think I was gonna ever let my future son beat up other kid to grow testosterone and be "a real man"
@itsjustrenelle if you want to know why this ad has been getting so many hate... You should search it on youtube
@itsjustrenelle ps it's okay... I think of this as a debate... Please don't turn this into an argument

@cobbalt.madinchi 1) i think I was very specific on the word “if”. 2) so you don’t actually think this ad is offensive, you’re just following what other people say about it, other men that evidently don’t like being told to behave like adults. Hm. Cool 👌🏽
@itsjustrenelle 1) okay 2) I don't think this ad is very offensive

@itsjustrenelle I think it's a very low grade offensive....I'm offended by this ad because they target only one gender... Men... I think they should be equal but they're not showing any equality here... Most of it is targeted to men .... I think they should include women wrongdoings too like 1. Rape (same as men) 2.harrasement(also same)... I don't know why Gillette is so small minded.... Supporting men at first but at the end they support women... Why not support both, so that this world would be at peace with gender equality... At the same time I support this ad because there's a lot of guys who can't control themselves and do bad things same to women too....ps I respect to those who got raped and I really do think they should seek help and report it....but it's hard to see men getting raped by a woman or a man but doesn't get to report it because "suck it up, be a man" thing always goes around their head... No wonder a lot of men around the world goes to suicide and stuff because they're told to "shut up and man up" their whole lives... I was once suicidal and tried to end my life myself but later failed and I realized that there's more to life and I should keep going..... That's why I am offended by this ad... Because it brings back the dark side thinking I'm worthless and stuff... I think Gillette should make an ad about how widespread suicide is amongst humanity

@cobbalt.madinchi Gillette is sticking to their theme. It does not say “ be the best woman you can be” it says “ be the best men you can be”. If you don’t do these things that the men in the video do, Gillette isn’t talking about you or to you. It’s saying when you see other men doing these things, hold them accountable. It’s quite simple, but only some men will get it. I also hope you take into account that female rape cases don’t even come close to the rate of male rape cases. I support convicting female rapist with the same sentence regardless of gender. But you cannot begin to compare the statistics. Gillette is reminding men who behave like trash, to be decent human beings. If you don’t behave like trash, this ad is not directed or about you. Very simple, as easy as 123
@itsjustrenelle I just said its not directed to me... It's directed to men

@cobbalt.madinchi yes, very clearly, men who behave like this. And decent men, if you will, hold other men that do this, accountable. If you see your guy friends harassing a girl on the street, will you say “im not gonna get in trouble because I ain’t doing it” or are you gonna stop them, and tell them to behave like adults. That’s what masculinity is.
Well said... And I lied... I am raised with toxic masculinity that's mostly the cause of my depression...what about you have you ever experienced depression?

@cobbalt.madinchi I’m sorry that you were raised like that. You don’t have to continue the pattern. Remember that you are loved and that you matter, even when you think you don’t. I have never experienced true depression but I know frankly what it’s like. And to keep it at bay, I make other people feel better about themselves, because seeing people come out from a bad place is one of my biggest passions. God willing, have a great day.
@itsjustrenelle don't worry about me I'm already past that... I just don't want the feelings come back ever again... And you have a great day too. Peace love - Cobbalt
@cobbalt.madinchi @itsjustrenelle i dont know how i ended up reading yr comment from top to the end haha. I think Im enjoying yr discussion tho lol haha. Its interesting. 🙌
@miaafiqahazizan thank you
@miaafiqahazizan thanks!
😂 @unicefmalaysia #kacheng is life
So...boys will girls???
I don't understand this kind of advanced England

This is fucking stupid. this is a very sexist stereotype. you shouldn't stereotype a whole group of people for for a few of the people in that group. That's like saying all muslims are bad. Which is very racist and ignorant. Just like you.
